subject: Re: [junit] Is it possible to use an IoC framework inside junit testcase?
msgSnippet: I have never used the Parameterized testcase but the code below makes me wonder why you can t do it like this: @RunWith(Parameterized.class) public class
messageBody:
I have never used the Parameterized testcase but the code below makes me
wonder why you can't
do it like this:

@RunWith(Parameterized.class)
public class VehicleTest{
@Parameters
public static Collection<Object[]> sets() {
List<Object[]> args = new ArrayList<Object[]>();

args.add(new Truck());
args.add(new Car(someArgument));
args.add(new Motor(someOtherArgument));

return args;
}

final Vehicle vehicle;
VehicleTest(Vehicle vehicle){
this.vehicle = vehicle;
}

@Test
testRun(){
....
}
}

Sure, that will create all instances at the same time, there is a
possibility if you don't watch out that the different instances can share
data
and so on but I don't know if that is a real issue for you...

another way would be to use anonymous factories which would defer creating
instances but is it really worth it?

public static Collection<Object[]> sets() {
List<Object[]> args = new ArrayList<Object[]>();

args.add(new VehicleFactory() { public void create(){return new
Car(parameter)});
...
return args;
}

or to use pico container or guice in populated in a @Before method and then
add the current vehicle to that one.
Go with what feels most natural and is the least work for you to write and
maintain.

Of course there is the possibility that I have overlooked something in
parameterized test-case that excludes the
above mentioned possibilities, in that case I'm sorry.

/J
